hints.hint 1: You can compute the quantiles using `np.quantile`

hints.Are they similar?: The SEM of the distribution and the estimated SEM computed from the bootstrap estimator are similar. The quantiles look about right too, compared to the distribution.

hints.Does it look as expected?: The bootstrap distribution does not look as I expected it to. It looks bumpy. This is probably because there are some very common exact amounts of salaries, meaning the median gets stuck there.

hints.hint 1: The documentation for `scipy.stats.norm.isf()` may be helpful.
hints.Result comparison: The CI is very close to the CI found by the bootstrap method.
